title: Digital Science Textbook Development Using Metasystem Learning Design: Experiment/Observation-Based Content Design

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced science theories (experimental design, data analysis) and high-level digital application skills (coding, authoring tools)
context.additional_context: Support for mid-level adult science learners to design effective digital learning experiences. Focus on content development systematically reflecting the scientific inquiry process (observation-hypothesis-experiment-analysis-conclusion).

learning_goals: Learners will apply user interface and data visualization standards with over 80% accuracy when designing digital science textbooks and effectively represent scientific variables and experimental data.
Learners will design interactive structures of science content using a meta-system approach and simulate hypothesis verification and evidence analysis processes.

Learners will develop a digital science textbook prototype (minimum 5 pages) with three or more interactive elements (quizzes, videos, virtual lab simulations) using HTML5/CSS3 or open-source authoring tools (e.g., Booktype) in a 4-week project-based assessment and achieve an "average" or higher rating in four of five expert evaluation rubric items.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
